title: NuScale PowerCorp Weekly News Summary
body:
**NuScale Power Announces $500 Million At-The-Market Stock Offering Program**

On August 13, 2025, NuScale Power Corporation (NYSE: SMR) announced the initiation of an at-the-market (ATM) offering program, allowing the company to offer and sell shares of its Class A common stock up to an aggregate value of $500 million. This strategic move aims to bolster the company's financial position as it advances its small modular reactor (SMR) technology. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/sec-filings/nuscale-power-announces-500-million-atthemarket-stock-offering-program-93CH-4187643?utm_source=openai))

**NuScale Power Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results**

In its Q2 2025 earnings report released on August 7, 2025, NuScale Power reported revenue of $8.1 million, marking a 710% increase compared to the same period in 2024. Despite this significant growth, the revenue fell short of analyst expectations by approximately 30%. The company also achieved early U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission approval for its 77-megawatt reactor design during this quarter. ([nasdaq.com](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/nuscale-smr-q2-revenue-soars-710?utm_source=openai))

**NuScale Power's Stock Experiences Notable Decline**

Over the past month, NuScale Power's stock has declined by 20.3%, underperforming the broader market and its industry peers. This downturn is attributed to weaker-than-expected Q3 2025 financial results and ongoing challenges in securing firm revenue-producing contracts. ([nasdaq.com](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/nuscale-power-plunges-20-month-time-hold-tight-or-exit?utm_source=openai))

key_points.text: NuScale Power announced a $500 million at-the-market stock offering program to strengthen its financial position.
The company reported a 710% year-over-year increase in Q2 2025 revenue but missed analyst expectations by 30%.
NuScale Power's stock declined by 20.3% over the past month due to weaker-than-expected financial results and challenges in securing firm contracts.
